item.title: Tara add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "Styx and The Stones may break my bones but 'More than Words' will never hurt me" -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Tara add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I'd far rather be happy than right any day." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Tara add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Tara add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Tara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tara add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Tara add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Tara add a quote by Sloane Crosley
item.description: "Life starts out with everyone clapping when you take a poo and goes downhill from there. " -- Sloane Crosley

item.title: Tara add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart. You are here to be swallowed up. And when it happens that you are broken, or betrayed, or left, or hurt, or death brushes near, let yourself sit by an apple tree and listen to the apples falling all around you in heaps, wasting their sweetness. Tell yourself you tasted as many as you could." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Tara add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Words! Mere words! How terrible they were! How clear, and vivid, and cruel! One could not escape from them. And yet what a subtle magic there was in them! They seemed to be able to give a plastic form to formless things, and to have a music of their own as sweet as that of viol or of lute. Mere words! Was there anything so real as words?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tara add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Tara add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Tara add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Tara add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Tara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tara add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Tara add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Tara add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "By now, it is probably very late at night, and you have stayed up to read this book when you should have gone to sleep. If this is the case, then I commend you for falling into my trap. It is a writer's greatest pleasure to hear that someone was kept up until the unholy hours of the morning reading one of his books. It goes back to authors being terrible people who delight in the suffering of others. Plus, we get a kickback from the caffeine industry..." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Tara add a quote by Mutant Enemy/Joss Whedon
item.description: "And by the way it's not about making money, it's about taking money. Destroying the status quo because the status is not quo. The world is a mess and I just need to rule it." -- Mutant Enemy/Joss Whedon

item.title: Tara add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Do not be too severe upon the errors of the people, but reclaim them by enlightening them." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Tara add a quote by Paul Newman
item.description: "We are such spendthrifts with our lives, the trick of living is to slip on and off the planet with the least fuss you can muster. I’m not running for sainthood. I just happen to think that in life we need to be a little like the farmer, who puts back into the soil what he takes out." -- Paul Newman

item.title: Tara add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "In a library we are surrounded by many hundreds of dear friends imprisoned by an enchanter in paper and leathern boxes." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Tara add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
